DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numerical value that represents the assessment of the residual muscle tension of a neonate, as a component of the APGAR test.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing._A component of the APGAR score, it is the numerical value assigned to an assessment of the residual muscle tension of a neonate. 0 = flaccid; 1 = flexion of extremities; 2 = active motion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Able to be adjusted readily to different conditions.: A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.

Concepts.definition: Able to be adjusted readily to different conditions.
A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Taking part in an activity.: The act or process of changing position or place; the change in position of a body part.

Concepts.definition: Exerting influence or producing an effect.
The act or process of changing position or place; the change in position of a body part.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
